com.communote.server.core.image.type

Class EntityImageProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.communote.server.api.core.image.ImageProvider
      • com.communote.server.core.image.type.EntityImageProvider

  • public class EntityImageProvider
extends ImageProvider
    Provider that loads the images of entities like topics or tags from binary properties.
    Author:
    Communote GmbH - http://www.communote.com/

    • Constructor Detail

      • EntityImageProvider

        public EntityImageProvider(String pathToDefaultImage,
                           EntityImageManagement.ImageType type)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        pathToDefaultImage - If the path starts with file: it is interpreted as a file URI otherwise it is interpreted as the name of a resource containing the default image. This resource will be loaded with the class loader of this class. If null, there will be no default image.
        type - The type of the image to load for the entity

    • Method Detail

      • canLoad

        public boolean canLoad(String imageIdentifier)
        Description copied from class: ImageProvider
        Test whether a provider can load the image. This should for instance return false if the provider was disabled completely or partially for certain identifiers. Checking whether the identified image exists is not necessary because ImageProvider.loadImage(String) will handle it.
        Specified by:
        canLoad in class ImageProvider
        Parameters:
        imageIdentifier - the identifier of the image
        Returns:
        whether the image can be loaded

        Overrides:

        the version string
        Throws:
        ImageNotFoundException - in case there is no default image
        See Also:
        ImageProvider.getVersionString(String)

      • getVersionString

        public String getVersionString(String imageIdentifier)
                        throws AuthorizationException,
                               ImageNotFoundException
        Description copied from class: ImageProvider
        Return a string which represents the version of the image. Whenever an image is modified the version string should change. An example of a version string could be the timestamp of the last modification.
        This method is called by the image manager from a method with the same name. The method of the image manager is intended to be called during image URL creation to get an image URL reflecting the latest image version. Since an image URL is usually rendered along with other content, this method should return quickly. The actual image retrieval (download) one the other hand which is done by loadImage can take longer.
        Specified by:
        getVersionString in class ImageProvider
        Parameters:
        imageIdentifier - the identifier of the image
        Returns:
        the version string of the image.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - in case the current user is not allowed to access the image
        ImageNotFoundException - in case there is no image for the imageIdentifier

      • isAuthorized

        public boolean isAuthorized(String imageIdentifier)
        Description copied from class: ImageProvider
        Return whether the current user is allowed to access the given image.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • isExternalProvider

        public boolean isExternalProvider()
        Description copied from class: ImageProvider
        Return whether this provider loads image from an external resource (like another server) and not from the local database or file system.
        Specified by:
        isExternalProvider in class ImageProvider
        Returns:
        true, if it is a provider for external images
